intro: Micranthes caroliniana, commonly known as the Carolina sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and along streambanks. It has hairy stems and leaves with a distinctive, slightly serrated edge. Micranthes caroliniana is an important plant for pollinators and is also valued for its ornamental appeal in native plant gardens.
